user_prompt:
You are an agent designed to generate text from data for a data-to-text natural language generation. 
You can be provided data in the form of xml, table, meaning representations, graphs etc.
Your task is to generate the appropriate text given the data information without omitting any field or adding extra information in essence called hallucination.

Dataset: webnlg

Here is the data, now generate text using the provided data:

Data: ['Alan_B._Miller_Hall | architect | Robert_A._M._Stern', 'Alan_B._Miller_Hall | address | "101 Ukrop Way"', 'Alan_B._Miller_Hall | buildingStartDate | "30 March 2007"', 'Alan_B._Miller_Hall | currentTenants | Mason_School_of_Business', 'Alan_B._Miller_Hall | location | Virginia', 'Alan_B._Miller_Hall | architecturalStyle | Georgian_architecture', 'Alan_B._Miller_Hall | owner | College_of_William_&_Mary']
Output:
final_response: Alan B. Miller Hall is located in Virginia at 101 Ukrop Way. Designed by architect Robert A. M. Stern in the Georgian architectural style, construction of the building began on March 30, 2007. The hall is currently occupied by the Mason School of Business and is owned by the College of William & Mary.
